about.title: Bridging hospitals and smart factories
about.intro: I’m KARIM EL HOUMAINI, based in Aix-les-Bains. My driver: putting AI to work for teams that must decide fast and accurately. From clinics to industrial plants, I turn messy data into reliable, understandable systems.
bio: During my work-study at GE Vernova I automate equipment validation through full-stack apps blending vision, business rules and cloud orchestrations.
At the University Hospital of Tangier I trained deep models detecting endoscopic anomalies, co-designing workflows with gastroenterologists.
I’m pursuing a second Master’s in Information-System Architecture to strengthen strategic oversight: governance, software industrialisation and value delivery.

focus.title: Currently focusing on
items: Interoperable industrial systems through secure microservices
Real-time vision applications for clinical quality
MLOps practices that derisk AI deployment

items.title: Measurable impact
items.description: Shared KPIs from day one to quantify value delivered.

items.title: Co-creation
items.description: Aligning field teams, data experts and IT with a shared vocabulary.

items.title: Ethical AI
items.description: Transparency, bias control and rigorous clinical validation.

about.photoAlt: Creative portrait of Karim El Houmaini

experience.title: Experience
experience.subtitle: Where AI, software and industrialisation intersect.

impact: Designed and deployed applications that automate quality-assurance workflows, cutting manual work by up to 40%.
Mapped processes with cross-functional partners to align regulatory constraints and UX.
Productionised containerised services (Spring Boot, Angular) on Kubernetes with enhanced observability.
Trained deep-learning models to detect anomalies in endoscopic images and videos.
Iterated with gastroenterologists to embed AI in clinical workflows.
Delivered a prototype integrated with hospital infrastructure.
Designed the full network architecture for an industrial site.
Audited servers and topology with hardening recommendations.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Case studies blending applied AI, cloud software and business impact.

items.title: Advanced image processing for endoscopic procedures
items.problem: Reduce the review time of endoscopy videos while catching anomalies earlier.
items.approach: Computer-vision pipeline with segmentation, anomaly detection and real-time clinician dashboard.
items.result: Faster review cycles and higher clinical confidence thanks to interpretable visual alerts.

items.title: Factory Acceptance Test digitisation & automation
items.problem: Make turbine FAT more reliable while eliminating paper-heavy, repetitive tasks.
items.approach: Spring Boot + Angular suite capturing field data, auto-generating reports and running on Kubernetes.
items.result: Productivity gains, stronger traceability and shared quality dashboards.

items.title: Intelligent healthcare monitoring system
items.problem: Anticipate vital anomalies in a connected-health context.
items.approach: IoT sensors, cloud gateway and AI models for early detection with multi-device dashboard.
items.result: Real-time notifications and concise insights for medical teams.

items.title: Microservice-based web app for medical crisis management
items.problem: Coordinate medical actors during critical events.
items.approach: Microservice architecture, secure APIs and multilingual responsive interface.
items.result: Smooth communication, exhaustive logging and rapid action triggering.

resume.title: Resume

summary.title: Professional summary
summary.content: AI & Software Engineer with experience in medical-image analysis and industrial process digitalisation. While completing a work-study programme at GE Vernova, I build full-stack applications that automate quality-assurance workflows. I hold a Master’s (Computer & Mobile Systems, with honours) and I’m pursuing a second Master’s (Information-System Architecture & Software Applications, CESI Grenoble). I blend deep technical expertise with strategic vision from collaborating with clinicians and engineering teams.
